instruction_text:
To resolve WiFi connectivity issues:

1. Check WiFi is enabled:
   - Look for WiFi icon in system tray
   - Click network icon and verify WiFi toggle is ON
   - Check for airplane mode (disable if enabled)
   - Use function key (F2, F12, etc.) to toggle WiFi

2. Restart WiFi adapter:
   - Device Manager > Network adapters
   - Find WiFi adapter
   - Right-click > Disable, then Enable
   - Or: netsh interface set interface "Wi-Fi" admin=disable
   - Then: netsh interface set interface "Wi-Fi" admin=enable

3. Check network password:
   - Verify WiFi password is correct
   - Try forgetting network and reconnecting
   - Check if network requires WPA2/WPA3

4. Update WiFi drivers:
   - Device Manager > Network adapters
   - Right-click WiFi adapter > Update driver
   - Download latest from manufacturer
   - Restart after update

5. Reset network configuration:
   - Settings > Network & Internet > Status
   - Click 'Network reset'
   - Restart computer
   - Reconnect to WiFi

6. Run network troubleshooter:
   - Right-click network icon > Troubleshoot problems
   - Or: Settings > Update & Security > Troubleshoot > Network Adapter
   - Follow troubleshooting steps

7. Check WiFi router/access point:
   - Verify router is powered on
   - Check router status lights
   - Restart router (power cycle)
   - Check if other devices can connect

8. Forget and reconnect:
   - Settings > Network & Internet > WiFi
   - Click network > Forget
   - Reconnect and enter password

9. Check IP configuration:
   - Open Command Prompt
   - Run: ipconfig /release
   - Run: ipconfig /renew
   - Run: ipconfig /flushdns
   - Check if IP address is assigned

10. Check for interference:
    - Move closer to WiFi router
    - Check for physical obstructions
    - Avoid interference from other devices
    - Change WiFi channel on router if possible

11. Check router settings:
    - Verify MAC address filtering (if enabled)
    - Check if device is blocked
    - Verify SSID is broadcasting
    - Check router firmware is updated

12. Reset TCP/IP stack:
    - PowerShell as Administrator
    - Run: netsh winsock reset
    - Run: netsh int ip reset
    - Restart computer

13. Check power management:
    - Device Manager > Network adapters
    - Right-click WiFi adapter > Properties
    - Power Management tab
    - Uncheck 'Allow computer to turn off this device'

14. Test with different WiFi:
    - Try connecting to different WiFi network
    - Use mobile hotspot to test
    - Determine if issue is network or device-specific

15. Check Windows updates:
    - Install pending Windows updates
    - Updates may include WiFi driver fixes
    - Restart after updates

16. Hardware troubleshooting:
    - Check WiFi antenna connections (if accessible)
    - Test WiFi on different device
    - Consider external WiFi adapter if internal failed
